name: SSC GD Constable Exam
description: A national-level examination conducted by the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) to recruit candidates for the posts of Constable (General Duty) in various Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) like BSF, CISF, CRPF, ITBP, SSB, as well as in the Secretariat Security Force (SSF), and Rifleman (General Duty) in Assam Rifles.

eligibility.ageLimit: 18-23 years. Age relaxation is applicable for reserved categories (SC, ST, OBC, Ex-Servicemen etc.) as per government rules.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Matriculation or 10th Class pass from a recognized Board/ University.

timeline.notificationDate: Expected on August 27, 2024 (for the 2025 exam cycle, as per SSC Calendar).
timeline.examDate: Expected in December 2024 - January 2025. (The last exam was held in Feb-March 2024).
timeline.resultDate: Results are declared separately for each stage.

stages.name: Stage 1: Computer Based Examination (CBE)
stages.description: An online objective test with 80 questions for a total of 160 marks, to be completed in 60 minutes. It has four parts: General Intelligence & Reasoning, General Knowledge & General Awareness, Elementary Mathematics, and English/Hindi.

stages.name: Stage 2: Physical Efficiency Test (PET) & Physical Standard Test (PST)
stages.description: Candidates who clear the CBE are called for PET/PST. This stage is mandatory and qualifying in nature. PET involves running, while PST involves measurement of height and chest.

stages.name: Stage 3: Detailed Medical Examination (DME) and Document Verification (DV)
stages.description: Candidates who qualify the PET/PST undergo a medical examination and document verification to ensure they meet all required standards.

examPattern.markingScheme: For the Computer Based Examination, +2 marks are awarded for each correct answer, and -0.25 marks are deducted for each incorrect answer.

syllabus.name: General Knowledge & General Awareness
topics: Economic Scene, General Polity, Indian Constitution

syllabus.name: Elementary Mathematics
topics: Computation of Whole Numbers, Decimals and Fractions
Averages, Interest, Profit and Loss, Discount
Mensuration, Time and Distance, Ratio and Time, Time and Work

syllabus.name: English / Hindi
topics: Candidates' ability to understand basic English/Hindi and their basic comprehension would be tested.
Spot the Error, Fill in the Blanks, Synonyms/Antonyms, Spellings
